description: An http request like /v1.1/images?limit=0 returns all images available. It should return an empty container.
title: API doesn't specify what limit=0 means

comments.content: An http request like /v1.1/images?limit=0 returns all images available. It should return an empty container.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: The comments in the code specify that if a limit=0 is given then limit will be set to the max limit. I am going to hold off until the intention is clarified or we decide to change it to return no results.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alex-meade

comments.content:
I've looked over the spec and it doesn't mention anything about a zero limit. I think we should either leave it the way it is or change a limit of zero to return empty results. Either way it should be mentioned in the spec.

Let me know what you guys think
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alex-meade

comments.content:
The behaviour looks unchanged for ~10 months now.

Perhaps this can be counted as a vote for "leave it as limit=0 means no limit", and we can close this bug now?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fifieldt

comments.content: It makes more sense to interpret the integer literally.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: Added it to the nova bugtracker to start the discussion there for the functionality change
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fifieldt

comments.content:
Simply speaking,  if a parameter is invalid, an error message should be returned; if the parameter can be accepted, interpret it literally.

So if the back end service can accept parameter "limit = 0", I prefer returning empty result.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~daisy-ycguo

comments.content:
I agree Ying Chun Guo.
for most user, they will think that "limit=0" return empty result
but max result. this is normal if you have not pointed out.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lizheming-li

comments.content: It looks like limit 0 is largely implemented as empty list now
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Sorry to try and bring this one back to life, but i'm just not sure that its really invalid. Marked https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1494617 as duplicate.

Seems that for the images api this now implements the empty list . However I think that for flavors and servers api Ithat the behavior is still to use limit=0 as max_limit.  These should one day be consistent?

At the very least we should change the comments in http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/common.py#n206 to represent the new behavior.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mjdoffma

comments.content: the images API is a proxy to glance, so generally we let glance set the limits on that API.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: Making the proxies consistent with our usage is a bit beyond scope. I think this is a wishlist item which if someone ever wants to do, is fine, but I don't think we want an open artifact here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
